recruitment.rationale: Position 7 would be filled, but no compelling recruitment target in hand that beats holding cards. All current hand agents are non-Commercial faction which won't help immediate Market defense.

actions.ability: 5 Gain 6 crowns and place one influence in Market.
actions.roi: Best gold ability available plus free defensive placement

actions.ability: 4 Place two influence in Docks and gain 2 crowns.
actions.roi: Expands Docks presence (currently empty) while generating gold

influence_placements.rationale: FORTRESS - 6 pool + 1 from Harrow ability = 7 total. P3 cannot break this with 25 pool if split across multiple targets.
FORTRESS - Banking House protected. 3 VP secured.
Solid defense for Spice Stalls. P3 would need 5+ to take it.
LOCK courtier at 4/4 - no one can contest Maritime control

defensive_analysis.threat: P3 has 25 influence pool and will attack Market
defensive_analysis.mitigation: Fortified all 3 Market squares to 4+ influence each. P3 would need to concentrate ALL 25 cubes on a single square to guarantee victory, sacrificing other opportunities.
defensive_analysis.worst_case: P3 takes MKT_05 (4 inf) with 5+ cubes, but cannot take MKT_02 (7 inf) or MKT_03 (6 inf) without massive overcommitment
defensive_analysis.expected_outcome: Retain at least 6 VP of Market territory (MKT_02 + MKT_03)

reasoning: DEFENSIVE FORTRESS STRATEGY: P3's 25-cube assault is imminent. Rather than spreading thin, I've built three fortresses in my highest-value Market squares. The gold engine fires for +12 crowns, bringing reserves to 33 - maintaining economic dominance. Calico's ability expands into empty Docks for future VP. Harbormaster Blackwater locked at 4/4 ensures Maritime courtier remains mine permanently. At 58 VP and 33 gold, even if P3 takes MKT_05, I maintain the lead and can counterattack next turn with my superior treasury.
